description: This is my first mosaic, a 2x2 primarily centered on the dust between the Cygnus Wall and Pelican nebula. It look me a few tries to get the settings right in AstroPixelProcessor; I've put what I used below. Thanks for checking out the finished result! ----------------------------- AstroPixelProcessor ----------------------------- First stacked each 4 panels separately and for each filter, so 12 separate stacks. Settings left at default except LNC set to 2nd degree with 3 iterations. Next, stitched the 4 panels together (one set per filter), bringing them in as light frames. Used the following settings: [Registration] - Scale Stop = 10 (increase if needed based on overlap) - Dynamic Distortion Correction = CHECKED - Same Camera and Optics = UNCHECKED - Registration Mode = Mosaic [Normalization] - Mode = advanced [Integration] - LNC = 2nd deg 3 iterations. - Enable MBB = CHECKED - MBB slider = % of panel overlap, 18% in this case. --------------- Pixinsight --------------- 1. Deconvolution on Ha only. 2. TGV Denoise & MMT (Jon Rista method) used for noise reduction. 3. Masked Stretch, then Histogram slightly. 4. Star Reduction on Sulfur II using Adam Block technique with Starnett++. 5. PixelMath SHO combine: ---- Red: 70% SII, 23% Ha, 7% OIII ---- Green: 20% SII, 60% Ha, 20% OIII ---- Blue: 8% SII, 8% Ha, 84% OIII 6. Star Reduction on clone of Ha, used for Lum, then applied to RGB. 7. Color adjustments, SCNR, masks with curves, etc... ---------------- Photoshop ---------------- 1. Saturation adjustment, final color tweaking. 2. Spot cleanup of over-saturated stars. 3. Smart Sharpening with edges mask.
title: Cygnus Dust - NGC 7000, Pelican, Wall
